# Crosshair and Grid Line Width Calculations

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]{.admonitionIcon_Rf37}tip

It is recommend that you first read the [Pixel Perfect
Rendering](../../pixel-perfect-rendering.html) page.

The following functions can be used to get the calculated width that the
library would use for a crosshair or grid line at a specific device
pixel ratio.

``` {.prism-code .language-typescript .codeBlock_bY9V .thin-scrollbar tabindex="0" style="color:#393A34;background-color:#f6f8fa"}
/**
 * Default grid / crosshair line width in Bitmap sizing
 * @param horizontalPixelRatio - horizontal pixel ratio
 * @returns default grid / crosshair line width in Bitmap sizing
 */
    horizontalPixelRatio: number
): number {
    return Math.max(1, Math.floor(horizontalPixelRatio));
}

/**
 * Default grid / crosshair line width in Media sizing
 * @param horizontalPixelRatio - horizontal pixel ratio
 * @returns default grid / crosshair line width in Media sizing
 */
    horizontalPixelRatio: number
): number {
    return (
        gridAndCrosshairBitmapWidth(horizontalPixelRatio) / horizontalPixelRatio
    );
}
```
